children.subject:
I can't speak to 161 (never taken it) but I took 170 and 184 the same semester along with two pretty time intensive breadth classes.

It was doable but definitely high workload. 170 being problem set heavy and 184 being programming heavy was a nice complement though, and I had a really solid group in 170 to talk through the homework questions with.

My perception of 161 is that it also has projects with high-frequency, but that the projects are relatively straightforward. I would say that 184 is also a lot of work, but how much time you will actually spend varies greatly (basically it's not hard to get it right the first time, but if you run into bugs, they can be pretty tricky). I relied pretty heavily on my interest in graphics to carry me through the class.

history.content: Is the workload for these 3 classes doable in one semester? Can anyone vouch for any of these classes in terms of difficulty/amount of projects/assignments? Thanks!
history.subject: CS170, 184, and 161 workload
